news_header: Klaus Iohannis resigned as Romania's president after two terms, marking an ignominious end to his presidency. Once seen as a reform hero, he leaves office as the most unpopular president in post-communist Romania.
news_original_title: Romania at the end of Klaus Iohannis' two-term presidency
news_text: His resignation comes amid impeachment proceedings initiated by far-right parties. Iohannis' presidency saw a rise in right-wing forces, and his departure raises concerns about the political future of Romania. Observers are divided on the implications of his resignation, especially in light of a controversial presidential election that was annulled due to alleged fraud.
